basics.name: Junichi Koganemaru
basics.label: Postdoctoral Teaching Associate & ML Enthusiast
basics.summary: Ph.D. in Applied Mathematics, specializing in the analysis of the Navier-Stokes equations. Expert in solving complex problems, communicating technical ideas, and training/deploying ML models. Seeking a Machine Learning Engineer or related role to apply analytical expertise and programming skills.

work.name: Carnegie Mellon University
work.position: Postdoctoral Teaching Associate & Summer Research Mentor
highlights: Designed and taught advanced courses in Linear Algebra and Differential Equations (500+ students).
Developed course material for Statistical Learning.
Mentored 5 top students on Physics-Informed Neural Networks (PINNs) and LSTM models.
Co-advised 13 students on quantitative modeling using Black-Scholes and Bachelier models.

education.summary: Thesis: Traveling wave solutions to the free boundary incompressible Navier-Stokes equations. Research on Nonlinear PDEs, Harmonic Analysis, and Functional Analysis. Published in top journals (JFA, JDE). Graduate Research Fellowship, Hugh D. Young Graduate Student Teaching Award (2022).

publications.name: Traveling wave solutions to the free boundary incompressible Navier-Stokes equations with Navier boundary conditions
Traveling wave solutions to the inclined or periodic free boundary incompressible Navier-Stokes equations

projects.name: Bird Species Identification on Audio Samples using CNNs
highlights: Awarded top 5 project out of 50+ in Erdős Institute Data Science Boot Camp.
Developed PyTorch CNN models to classify 180+ bird species from a 24GB audio database.
Optimized preprocessing and model architecture to boost ROC-AUC score by 14%.

projects.name: Detecting LLM Generated Text with SBERT
highlights: Conducted data analysis on ChatGPT-generated text, detected data leakage.
Fine-tuned SBERT transformer to achieve 92% classification accuracy on holdout testing data.

projects.name: Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) for Document Question Answering
highlights: Developed a RAG system combining retrieval-based and generative models to answer questions from documents.
Implemented dense passage retrieval with a BERT-based encoder and fine-tuned a GPT-3 model for generation.
Achieved a top-5 retrieval accuracy of 85% and a BLEU score of 42 on the SQuAD dataset.
Deployed the model as a web application using Flask, enabling users to input documents and receive answers in real-time.
